name: Shareholders' Agreement
description: Comprehensive shareholders' agreement for post-investment governance, covering board composition, reserved matters, pre-emption, drag/tag rights, and leaver provisions

clauses.title: BACKGROUND
clauses.body_md:
**A.** The Shareholders are the registered holders of shares in the Company as set out in Schedule 1.

**B.** The Shareholders wish to regulate their relationship and the conduct of the Company's affairs on the terms of this Agreement.

**C.** This Agreement shall take effect from the date hereof and shall govern the rights and obligations of the Shareholders.

**IT IS AGREED:**

clauses.title: 1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION
clauses.body_md:
1.1 In this Agreement:

**"Articles"** means the articles of association of the Company as amended from time to time.

**"Board"** means the board of directors of the Company from time to time.

**"Business Day"** means a day (other than a Saturday, Sunday or public holiday) when banks are open for business in {{business_day_location}}.

**"Competing Business"** means any business that competes with the Company's business as conducted from time to time or as proposed to be conducted.

**"Director"** means a director of the Company from time to time.

**"Drag Notice"** has the meaning given in Clause 9.1.

**"Exit Event"** means:

(a) a sale of all or substantially all of the assets or business of the Company;

(b) a sale of shares resulting in a person (or group of persons acting in concert) acquiring more than 50% of the voting rights in the Company;

(c) a merger, consolidation, or scheme of arrangement involving the Company (other than a transaction in which the existing Shareholders retain majority control); or

(d) an initial public offering of the Company's shares on a recognised stock exchange.

**"Financial Year"** means the Company's financial year.

**"Founder"** means any Shareholder designated as "founder" in Schedule 1.

**"Fully Diluted Share Capital"** means the total number of shares in issue assuming the exercise or conversion of all outstanding options, warrants, and convertible securities.

**"Good Leaver"** has the meaning given in Clause 11.2.

**"Investor"** means any Shareholder designated as "investor" in Schedule 1.

**"Majority Shareholders"** means Shareholders holding more than 50% of the shares (or, where specified, a different percentage).

**"Ordinary Shares"** means the ordinary shares in the capital of the Company.

**"Preference Shares"** means the preference shares of any class in the capital of the Company.

**"Reserved Matters"** means the matters set out in Clause 5.

**"Securities"** means any shares, debentures, warrants, options, or other securities of the Company.

**"Transfer"** means to sell, assign, transfer, encumber, create any security interest over, or otherwise dispose of any legal or beneficial interest in shares, and **"Transferring"** and **"Transferred"** shall be construed accordingly.

1.2 References to Clauses and Schedules are to clauses of and schedules to this Agreement.

1.3 Headings are for convenience only and do not affect interpretation.

clauses.title: 2. SHARE CAPITAL AND SHAREHOLDERS
clauses.body_md:
2.1 The current shareholdings of the Shareholders are set out in Schedule 1.

2.2 The Shareholders confirm that:

   (a) the shares held by them are fully paid (or shall be paid in accordance with the subscription agreement executed contemporaneously with this Agreement);
   
   (b) they are the sole legal and beneficial owners of their respective shares; and
   
   (c) their shares are free from any encumbrances, charges, or third-party rights.

2.3 The Articles are deemed to be incorporated into this Agreement and the Shareholders shall procure that the Articles are amended as necessary to give effect to this Agreement. In the event of any conflict between this Agreement and the Articles, this Agreement shall prevail and the Shareholders shall procure that the Articles are amended accordingly.

clauses.title: 3. BOARD COMPOSITION AND PROCEDURES
4. RESERVED MATTERS - SHAREHOLDER APPROVAL
5. INFORMATION AND REPORTING
clauses.body_md:
5.1 **Annual Financial Statements**: The Company shall deliver to each Shareholder:

   (a) audited annual financial statements within [120 days] of each Financial Year end; and
   
   (b) a report from the Directors on the Company's performance and prospects.

5.2 **Management Accounts**: The Company shall deliver to each Investor Shareholder:

   (a) unaudited management accounts within [30 days] of the end of each [quarter / month];
   
   (b) comparison against budget and prior period; and
   
   (c) a narrative report on key business developments.

5.3 **Budget and Business Plan**: The Company shall deliver to each Investor Shareholder:

   (a) an annual budget at least [30 days] before the start of each Financial Year; and
   
   (b) a business plan covering at least [3 years] forward, updated annually.

5.4 **Other Information**: The Company shall promptly notify Shareholders of:

   (a) any material litigation, regulatory investigation, or dispute;
   
   (b) any material breach of law or regulation;
   
   (c) any actual or threatened insolvency;
   
   (d) any event which would constitute a breach of any warranty given by the Company or the Founders; and
   
   (e) any matter which could reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on the Company's business, assets, or financial condition.

5.5 **Inspection Rights**: Each Investor Shareholder shall have the right (at reasonable times and on reasonable notice) to:

   (a) inspect the Company's books and records; and
   
   (b) discuss the Company's affairs with the Directors and management.

5.6 **Confidentiality**: All information provided under this Clause 5 shall be treated as confidential and used solely for the purpose of monitoring the Shareholder's investment.

clauses.title: 6. PRE-EMPTION RIGHTS ON NEW ISSUES
clauses.body_md:
6.1 **Pre-emption on New Issues**: If the Company proposes to issue new Securities (other than pursuant to Clause 6.6), it shall first offer them to existing Shareholders on the following basis.

6.2 **Pre-emption Notice**: The Company shall give written notice (a "**Pre-emption Notice**") to each Shareholder:

   (a) specifying the number and class of Securities to be issued;
   
   (b) the price per Security (or the method of determining the price);
   
   (c) the other material terms of the proposed issue; and
   
   (d) inviting the Shareholder to subscribe for their pro rata share within [20 Business Days].

6.3 **Pro Rata Entitlement**: Each Shareholder's pro rata entitlement shall be calculated as:

```
Shareholder's existing shareholding (fully diluted) / Total Fully Diluted Share Capital × New Securities being issued
```

6.4 **Exercise of Rights**:

   (a) A Shareholder wishing to exercise pre-emption rights must notify the Company in writing within [20 Business Days], specifying the number of Securities it wishes to subscribe for (up to its pro rata entitlement).
   
   (b) If any Shareholder does not take up its full entitlement, the Company shall offer the unsubscribed Securities to those Shareholders who have applied for more than their pro rata entitlement, in proportion to their existing shareholdings.

6.5 **Issue to Third Parties**: If, after the procedure in Clauses 6.2-6.4:

   (a) any Securities remain unsubscribed, the Company may issue them to third parties within [90 days] on terms no more favourable than those offered to Shareholders; or
   
   (b) if the Company does not issue the Securities within [90 days], the pre-emption procedure must be restarted.

6.6 **Exceptions**: Pre-emption rights do not apply to:

   (a) shares issued pursuant to the exercise of options or warrants granted under employee share option plans approved by Shareholders;
   
   (b) shares issued as consideration for an acquisition approved as a Reserved Matter;
   
   (c) shares issued in connection with an IPO; or
   
   (d) [other agreed exceptions].

clauses.title: 7. RESTRICTIONS ON TRANSFER
clauses.body_md:
7.1 **General Restriction**: No Shareholder shall Transfer any shares except in accordance with this Agreement.

7.2 **Permitted Transfers**: A Shareholder may Transfer shares without complying with Clause 7.3:

   (a) to an affiliate or related entity (provided the transferee enters into a deed of adherence to this Agreement and, on ceasing to be an affiliate, the shares are transferred back);
   
   (b) for Founder Shareholders: with the prior written consent of [Investors holding [●]% of Preference Shares]; or
   
   (c) pursuant to the drag-along provisions in Clause 9.

7.3 **Right of First Refusal**: Subject to Clause 7.2, if a Shareholder (the "**Seller**") wishes to Transfer any shares:

   **(a) Offer Notice**: The Seller shall give written notice to the Company and all other Shareholders, specifying:
   
      (i) the number and class of shares to be sold (the "**Sale Shares**");
      
      (ii) the proposed purchaser;
      
      (iii) the price and other material terms; and
      
      (iv) evidence that the proposed transfer is on arm's length terms with a bona fide third party.

   **(b) Company Right**: The Company shall have the right to purchase the Sale Shares within [20 Business Days] on the same terms.

   **(c) Shareholder Right**: If the Company does not exercise its right, each other Shareholder shall have the right to purchase the Sale Shares (pro rata to their existing shareholdings) within a further [20 Business Days] on the same terms.

   **(d) Sale to Third Party**: If the Sale Shares are not purchased by the Company or Shareholders, the Seller may sell them to the proposed third-party purchaser within [60 days] on terms no more favourable than those offered to the Company and Shareholders, subject to the tag-along rights in Clause 8.

7.4 **Transfers in Breach**: Any Transfer in breach of this Agreement shall be void and the Company shall not register the transfer or recognise the purported transferee as a Shareholder.

clauses.title: 8. TAG-ALONG RIGHTS
clauses.body_md:
8.1 **Tag-Along Right**: If any Founder Shareholder (the "**Selling Founder**") proposes to Transfer shares to a third party (other than pursuant to a Permitted Transfer or drag-along), each other Shareholder shall have the right to participate in the sale on a pro rata basis.

8.2 **Tag-Along Notice**: The Selling Founder shall include in the Offer Notice under Clause 7.3:

   (a) confirmation that this is a tag-along opportunity; and
   
   (b) an invitation to other Shareholders to participate.

8.3 **Exercise of Tag-Along**: A Shareholder wishing to exercise tag-along rights must notify the Selling Founder within [20 Business Days], specifying the number of shares it wishes to sell.

8.4 **Pro Rata Allocation**: If the third-party purchaser will not purchase all the shares offered:

   (a) the total number of shares to be sold shall be allocated between the Selling Founder and tagging Shareholders pro rata to the number of shares each wished to sell; and
   
   (b) the Selling Founder shall reduce the number of shares it sells accordingly.

8.5 **Completion**: All Shareholders participating in the tag-along sale shall:

   (a) sell their shares on the same terms and conditions;
   
   (b) give the same warranties and indemnities (subject to appropriate caps for non-Founder Shareholders); and
   
   (c) complete the sale simultaneously.

8.6 **Failure to Complete**: If any tagging Shareholder fails to complete the sale, the Selling Founder may either:

   (a) proceed with the sale of their own shares only; or
   
   (b) terminate the entire transaction.

clauses.title: 9. DRAG-ALONG RIGHTS
10. LIQUIDATION PREFERENCES AND EXIT PROCEEDS
clauses.body_md:
10.1 **Application**: This Clause 10 applies to the distribution of proceeds on:

   (a) a liquidation, dissolution, or winding up of the Company;
   
   (b) a sale of all or substantially all of the Company's assets; or
   
   (c) a deemed liquidation event pursuant to an Exit Event (as defined in the Articles).

10.2 **Liquidation Preference**: Holders of Preference Shares shall be entitled to receive, in priority to holders of Ordinary Shares, an amount equal to:

```
{{liquidation_preference_multiple}} × Original Subscription Price + any accrued but unpaid dividends
```

(the "**Liquidation Preference**")

10.3 **Participating Preferred**:

{{#if participating_preferred}}
After payment of the Liquidation Preference, holders of Preference Shares shall participate with holders of Ordinary Shares in the distribution of remaining proceeds on an as-converted basis.
{{else}}
After payment of the Liquidation Preference, holders of Preference Shares shall not participate further in the distribution of proceeds. All remaining proceeds shall be distributed to holders of Ordinary Shares.
{{/if}}

10.4 **Distribution Order**: Proceeds shall be distributed in the following order:

   (a) **First**, to holders of [Series B] Preference Shares until they have received their Liquidation Preference;
   
   (b) **Second**, to holders of [Series A] Preference Shares until they have received their Liquidation Preference;
   
   (c) **Third**, [if participating preferred: all remaining proceeds to all Shareholders on an as-converted pro rata basis] [if non-participating: all remaining proceeds to holders of Ordinary Shares pro rata].

10.5 **Conversion Option**: Before any distribution, each holder of Preference Shares may elect to convert their Preference Shares into Ordinary Shares at the then-applicable conversion rate and participate as a holder of Ordinary Shares if that would result in greater proceeds.

10.6 **Deemed Liquidation**: The Shareholders shall procure that the Articles provide that the following shall be deemed to be liquidation events for the purposes of this Clause 10:

   (a) a sale, lease, transfer, or exclusive licence of all or substantially all of the Company's assets;
   
   (b) a merger or consolidation in which the Company is not the surviving entity or in which existing Shareholders do not retain majority control; or
   
   (c) any other transaction approved by the Board as a deemed liquidation event.

clauses.title: 11. LEAVER PROVISIONS
clauses.body_md:
11.1 **Application**: This Clause 11 applies to any Founder or employee Shareholder who ceases to be actively involved in the Company's business (a "**Leaver**").

11.2 **Good Leaver**: A Leaver shall be a "**Good Leaver**" if their involvement ceases due to:

   (a) death or permanent disability preventing them from performing their duties;
   
   (b) dismissal or removal without cause;
   
   (c) resignation with the consent of the Board after [3 years] of service; or
   
   (d) any other reason agreed by the Board (acting reasonably).

11.3 **Bad Leaver**: A Leaver shall be a "**Bad Leaver**" if their involvement ceases:

   (a) by resignation without the consent of the Board within [3 years] of [the date of this Agreement / the date of their investment];
   
   (b) by summary dismissal for cause (including gross misconduct, material breach of duties, or breach of this Agreement); or
   
   (c) due to any act of fraud, dishonesty, or wilful misconduct.

11.4 **Other Leavers**: Any Leaver who is not a Good Leaver or Bad Leaver shall be treated as [a Good Leaver / an intermediate leaver with pricing between Good and Bad].

11.5 **Valuation and Purchase**:

   **(a) Good Leaver**: A Good Leaver's shares shall be valued at Fair Market Value (as defined below) and the Company (or its nominee) shall have the right to purchase:
   
      (i) all unvested shares (if subject to vesting) at the lower of Fair Market Value or the price originally paid; and
      
      (ii) all vested shares at Fair Market Value.

   **(b) Bad Leaver**: A Bad Leaver's shares shall be valued at the lower of:
   
      (i) Fair Market Value; or
      
      (ii) the price originally paid for the shares,
   
   and the Company (or its nominee) shall have the right to purchase all such shares at that price.

11.6 **Fair Market Value**: "**Fair Market Value**" means:

   (a) if the shares are listed on a stock exchange, the average trading price over the [30 days] prior to the Leaver date;
   
   (b) if a financing round has completed within the preceding [6 months], the price per share in that round (adjusted for different share classes);
   
   (c) otherwise, the fair market value determined by an independent chartered accountant or valuation expert jointly appointed by the Company and the Leaver (or, in the absence of agreement, appointed by [the president of the relevant accounting institute]).

11.7 **Exercise of Rights**:

   (a) The Company shall give notice to the Leaver within [60 days] of the Leaver date if it wishes to purchase the Leaver's shares.
   
   (b) Completion of the purchase shall occur within [30 days] of agreement (or determination) of the price.
   
   (c) Payment may be made in instalments over [12 months] with interest at [●]% per annum.

11.8 **Continuing Restrictions**: Until the Leaver's shares are purchased (or the right to purchase lapses), the Leaver:

   (a) shall remain bound by this Agreement;
   
   (b) shall not Transfer the shares except as permitted by this Agreement; and
   
   (c) shall have no voting rights except as required by law.

clauses.title: 12. ANTI-DILUTION PROTECTION
13. WARRANTIES AND UNDERTAKINGS
14. TERMINATION
clauses.body_md:
14.1 **Termination Events**: This Agreement shall terminate:

   (a) by written agreement of all Shareholders;
   
   (b) on completion of an IPO; or
   
   (c) on completion of an Exit Event in which all Shareholders sell all of their shares.

14.2 **Partial Termination**: On a Shareholder ceasing to hold any shares, this Agreement shall cease to apply to that Shareholder (except for Clauses that expressly survive).

14.3 **Survival**: Clauses [1 (Definitions), 7.4 (Transfers in Breach), 13 (Warranties), 15 (Confidentiality), and 17 (General)] shall survive termination.

clauses.title: 15. CONFIDENTIALITY
clauses.body_md:
15.1 Each Shareholder shall keep confidential and not disclose to any third party:

   (a) the terms of this Agreement;
   
   (b) any information provided pursuant to Clause 5 (Information Rights); and
   
   (c) any other confidential information concerning the Company or its business,

except as required by law, to professional advisers (under obligations of confidentiality), or with the prior written consent of the Company.

15.2 This obligation shall survive termination of this Agreement for [5 years].

clauses.title: 16. GENERAL PROVISIONS
clauses.body_md:
16.1 **Entire Agreement**: This Agreement (together with the Articles and any documents referred to herein) constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all previous agreements relating to its subject matter.

16.2 **Amendments**: This Agreement may be amended only by written agreement signed by [all Shareholders / Shareholders holding at least [●]%].

16.3 **Severability**: If any provision is held invalid or unenforceable, it shall be severed and the remaining provisions shall continue in full effect.

16.4 **Waiver**: No failure to exercise any right shall constitute a waiver. Waivers must be in writing.

16.5 **Further Assurance**: Each party shall execute all documents and take all actions reasonably necessary to give effect to this Agreement.

16.6 **Counterparts**: This Agreement may be executed in counterparts.

16.7 **Notices**: All notices shall be in writing and delivered to the addresses in Schedule 1.

16.8 **Costs**: Each party shall bear its own costs of this Agreement.

16.9 **Third Parties**: No third party has any right to enforce this Agreement.

16.10 **Assignment**: No party may assign this Agreement without the consent of all other parties, except that rights may be assigned to a transferee of shares who enters into a deed of adherence.

clauses.title: 17. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION
clauses.body_md:
17.1 This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with {{governing_law_text}}.

17.2 The parties irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of {{venue_text}}.

17.3 **Dispute Resolution**: Any dispute arising out of this Agreement shall:

   (a) first be referred to the Chief Executive Officer and lead Investor representative for good faith negotiation for [30 days]; and
   
   (b) if not resolved, be [referred to mediation / arbitration / litigation] in accordance with [specify rules/procedures].

metadata.compliance_notes: Post-investment shareholders' agreement. Must comply with corporate law of jurisdiction (e.g., CA 2006 for UK; DGCL for Delaware). Pre-emption rights may be statutory (UK CA 2006 ss.561-577) or contractual. Leaver provisions must be reasonable under employment/restraint of trade law. Drag-along must not breach minority protection rules. Anti-dilution and liquidation preferences enforceable if properly documented in Articles.
